text: 22 year old Stephanie Browne is jarred from a peaceful sl as the alarm clock BUZZES. She hits the snooze button and plops back down onto the pillow. After a few seconds of p sleeping bliss, she wills herself up. She moves through her Ikea furnished bedroom, past a "Han there, baby" poster and into the bathroom.
Stephanie turns on the shower. While waiting for the wate heat up, she looks into the mirror and with exaggerated pronunciation, recites:
There is no friction, with proper diction. Good sounds abound, when the mouth is round. She catches herself on the last word, a hint of "Missouri twang" slipping through.
Round. Yawn. She slips off her nightgown and lumbers into the steaming shower.
She opens the refrigerator: A half grapefruit sits next t inviting slice of chocolate cake. She's tempted, but choo the grapefruit.

A sunny Southern California day. Commuters speed by. Stephanie's FORD FOCUS pulls into the PARKING STRUCTURE, across the street from the BANK OF CALIFORNIA. Well, you're a little cutie.

Hey! Slow down! The Van roars past. She pets the Kitten. It PURRS and lic Stephanie's face. She sets it down.
Go on home. Shoo now! She heads for the Bank. The kitten follows. She turns bac frowning.
Shoo!
Stephanie site at her desk, across from a young MEXICAN COUPLE. She studies their mortgage. application.

We keep getting the same thing. Because I'm not employed by an American company, they won't take my application until they get my solvency statement. And the Mexican Treasury Department says that's going to take at least four more weeks.
And the house will be gone by then.
It says, here your employed by Pemex?
That's right.
Isn't Pemex a subsidiary of Union Oil?
a MEXICAN MAN Yes. So? 0

So technically, your employer is an American company. I think we can make this work. I'll call you this afternoon and let you know. The happy couple shake Stephanie's hand and exit. ELLEN, Stephanie's pretty, twenty two year old, roommate, flops into the seat across from her.
I need clarification on the shoe issue.
Okay...
First of all-- you know you've got the only perfect pair of black dress shoes in L.A. So was that a definite, irrevocable, "no way" or t just a rather not at this time, "no  way"?
It's an absolutely, positively, forget about the shoes already, "no way". They're my only good pair and I need them in good shape for tomorrow.
What's Up?
Dinner with Ray's parents. Ellen picks up a desktop photo: A shot of Stephanie and h handsome boyfriend, Ray, locked in an embrace, standing i the spray of a waterfall.
Ray's got a nice butt. Really tight
Stephanie takes back her photo.
1 --I know. Thanks.

He's a keeper. But I told you about his mom, she's another story. I used to waitress at her country club, and with her, it's all about what private school you went to and who you know. You still up for that promotion? That would help. Stephanie looks longingly to...
of the former Assistant Manager. The large oak desk. The executive chair. Waiting to be filled. Stephanie turns back, pushing the thought away.
I'm not putting on a show. She'll either accept me for who I am or not. 4
Are you reading self help books again? The Kitten peers out through Stephanie's partially opened desk drawer.
Hello there! Ellen reaches for the Kitty but Stephanie waves her off.
--Shhhl I can't let my boss see him. Stephanie glances to her manager, MR. JACKS, a heavyset m sitting behind a large desk.
What about the shoes?
I told you. No. Now beat it.
Mr. Jacks sneezes, rubs his nose. He looks suspiciously a the bank for the source of his allergy. 0
Uh Oh. You better bring the kitty home for me.
Sure. If I can take the shoes.
I told you, no. Mr. Jacks sneezes again, his eyes water. He turns to his SECRETARY.
Has someone brought a damned animal into my bank?! Mr. Jacks looks about the Bank, his twitching nose leadin him toward Stephanie's desk.
Okay, fine! Take the shoes!
Hidden from Mr. Jack's view, Ellen quickly scoops up the Kitten and places it into her purse. As Mr. Jacks arrives at Stephanie's desk, he overhears:
Just don't expect me to take care of it. This catches Mr. Jack's Attention. He turns to the ladies wondering what they're talking about. Stephanie takes Ell hand and vigorously shakes it goodbye.
Of course not. I'll take care of everything. And thanks for choosing Bank of California. Ellen plays along.
Okay. Then I'll see you later. I mean--- whenever the next time I'm in the bank. You know-- for a loan.
Goodbye. As Ellen passes, Mr. Jacks sneezes again, harder.
Someone has definitely brought an animal in here. He eyes Ellen suspiciously as she exits.
I don't see any cats. Or any animals.
Hope to hell, not.
By the way, I put the paperwork for the Mcpherson loan on your desk.
Mcpherson?
That big corporate loan I've been trying to set up? It's just preliminary but--
Oh, right. I'll look it over when I get the chance.
Mr. Jacks, I was wondering it you had made any decision regarding the Assistant Manager's position yet?
I'm still deciding. Right now it's between Stu and yourself. 4
Stu? The trainee? Stephanie turns to see Stu, the balding loan officer who at his desk, watching, trying to figure out what Jacks is saying to her.

I know he's new but he's also quite aggressive and we like that. Don't get me wrong, you're well liked here, but we're also looking for someone who's not afraid to crunch the numbers and make the tough decisions.
Mr. Jacks, I feel that I'm perfectly capable of--
--I'll let you know as soon as,I decide. In the meantime, take him through our loan qualifying procedures... just in case.
Oh. okay.
And would you mind taking your lunch now?
Sure.
And on your way back, maybe you could bring me a turkey club? Stu overhears them as he passes by.
Turkey club. Excellent choice, J.J. Then to Stephanie:
Mind picking one up for me?
No problem. Jacks heads back toward his desk. Stephanie grabs her pur and keys and as she heads out, Stu calls after her:
On toasted rye! And spicy mustard! Stephanie doesn't like fetching lunch for the trainee but hides her displeasure.
Sure.
Stephanie enters the Ivy-covered red bricked Department o Psychology Building.
RAY DALTON, a handsome twenty-nine year old man is lectur before a class of UCLA students. They listen attentively.

The conscious mind abhors uncertainty. It seeks a pattern or reason for everything. When we can't find that pattern or reason, we sometimes ascribe it's cause to the world of the supernatural. The spiritual world is created by the human mind to conveniently explain everything we can't. So when does a belief in the supernatural cross into the field of abnormal behavior? Where do you, the Psychologist, come in? When these beliefs negatively affect our patients activities of daily living. Their jobs, their friends, their sense of well being-- The class bell RINGS.
Tomorrow we'll be covering the clinical manifestations of psychosis. You'll find it all t referenced in the text.
The students pack up their books. Ray smiles as he sees Stephanie enter the lecture hall, holding a bag of deli f
Stephanie eats a salad as she goes over a financial state of the Mcpherson Corporation. Ray grades papers.
How're things at the bank? How's that new position looking?
I don't know.
Really? You sounded so sure.
Well, now there's this new guy... they're considering him too. Ray sees how bummed out she is. He moves close, taking he his arms.
That job needs somebody with your experience. They know that. Stephanie nods.
Oh, I've got something for you. She rummages through her purse and hands Ray an envelope. removes a coin. An old nickle.
A 1925 Indian head! Hey, good find. Where'd you get it?
One of the tellers found it for me. Ray puts the coin back into the envelope and tucks it int his pocket.
Thanks.

I'd better get back to work. She quickly gathers her things. Ray returns to grading hi student's exams. The telephone RINGS. Ray hits the speakerphone. RAY. Doctor Dalton. It's the voice of an older woman, TRUDY.
Hello dear.
Hi Mom, can you hold on a sec? He turns from the phone, whispering to Stephanie:
I'll call you tonight. She kisses Ray and exits.
Stephanie stops at the water fountain for a drink.
Nothing much. Just had lunch with Stephanie. And trying to get these midterms graded-- She halts as she hears her name mentioned on Ray's speakerphone. She moves closer to Ray's office to eavesdr
--Stephanie? The one from the farm?
You know who she is. She's coming over for dinner tomorrow night to meet you and dad. 0
Ray, I'm sure she's sweet, but she doesn't sound...
What?
I mean she's just a teller at some bank right? Raymond there's a reason that your father and I raised you in a certain way. We have expectations.
Please, mom, not this again--

I heard that Julie Kulick is looking for someone to play tennis with. You know she graduated Yale law with honors. I'm told she's quite a successful attorney now. I gave you her number but her mother says you never called.
Because I'm with Stephanie. I'm not looking for anybody else.
Would it kill you to--
--Mom. I have to go. See you tomorrow night. Okay? Bye. A downhearted Stephanie quietly exits.
As Stephanie pours herself a cup of coffee, Stu and Mr. J take the first bites of their sandwiches. Stu makes a fac He inspects the sandwich, shakes his head.
(quietly to Mr. Jacks) She messed up my order. Stephanie heard that.
No I didn't, Stu.
Steph, I said "no mayo".
You never said that. Stu rolls his eyes to Mr. Jacks. Stephanie caught Stu's look, but what can she do? She exits.

Stephanie sits at her desk, entering data into her comput She glances across the bank to see Stu and Mr. Jacks emer from the break room. Stu is about to return to his desk w he remembers something: he's got two tickets to a Dodger that he can't use. Mr. Jacks happily accepts the tickets. Stephanie looks to the vacant office of the Assistant Manager. She can feel her promotion slipping away. SCRATCH... SCRATCH... Stephanie looks to the source of the sound... A withered hand. An involuntary tremor causes it's yellow fingernails to SCRATCH across the surface of Stephanie's desk... SCRATCH... SCRATCH... The hand belongs to MRS. SYLVIA GANUSH, the aged woman wh site across from Stephanie. She wears a.formal dress and from another era. The outfit is threadbare in spots but g care has been taken to maintain it.
(Hungarian accent) Will you help me?

Of course. What can I do for you? Mrs. Ganush coughs up phlegm and spits it into a linen handkerchief, which she tucks back into her puree. She ha Stephanie a bunch of crumpled papers. Stephanie reviews t
Mrs. "Ganush"? The old woman nods.

This is a delinquency notice... it says that the payment on your loan was due a number of months ago. And this other document... is a court order for repossession. The bank is informing you of their intent to repossess-your property at 325 Brandon street, tomorrow.,

The trucks are there now. The men are packing all my things. Private things. Please, make them stop. This is my home for twenty years. And I make every payment until the sickness took my eye. Mrs. Ganush turns her head to reveal a milky white eye. Stephanie hides her revulsion.
Well... do you have the payment with you now?
I hope to get it soon. I just need a little more time.
I don't think my manager is going to extend you anymore credit. I'd like to help but...
Please. Won't you try?

Okay. Wait here. Stephanie stands and moves off. The Old Woman picks throu bowl of hard candies on Stephanie's desk. Stephanie stands before Mr. Jacks. He acknowledges her without looking up from his work.
What's up?

I've got an elderly woman asking for an extension on her mortgage payment.. They're in the process of repossessing her home. She's on a fixed income and she's had some medical problems. I was wondering if we could give her a break. Stephanie hands Mr. Jacks the loan file. He puts on his bifocals, studies it. Stephanie glances over her shoulder.

Mrs. Ganush looks around to. make sure no one's watching, tips the bowl of hard candies into her purse. She reaches into her mouth and removes a set of stained dentures that wraps in her linen handkerchief. She places a piece of hard candy into her mouth and gums with a wet SUCKING sound. The Old Woman's one good eye, wanders about in ecstacy as she sucks on the sugary treat
Apparently, we've already granted her two extensions. And you know on this type of foreclosure, the bank makes a sizable amount in fees. He hands her back the file.
It would mean I'd have to throw her out of her house.

Tough decision. Your call. He leans back in his overstuffed leather chair and studie her. Stephanie glances to the vacant office of the Assist Manager. The large oak desk. The thick carpet. She sees a calculating Stu Rubin eyeing her from his workstation.
I'll take care of it.  Stephanie returns to her desk.
Mrs. Ganush, another extension on the loan is out of the question.
What?
I'm sorry.
No. Please, it's my home... I'm begging you.
I tried to talk my boss into it but he just wouldn't approve.
But where will I live?
Stephanie leafs through the loan documents. She finds a n
Mrs. Ganush, you've given your granddaughter as a reference... It says here, she lives nearby... Wouldn't you be better off living with her?
I would not burden her.
Okay well, there's several fine "assisted living" facilities for the elderly.
A nursing home? No. I will never live in one of those places1
Well, of course, that's your choice.
It's yours.
I'm sorry there's nothing I can do. Mrs. Ganush begins to sob.
I am proud woman, Miss Brown, and never have I begged for anything. But I will beg for you now. This one time. I humble myself before you.

That isn't necessary, please. Let's not make this personal. It's just the bank's policy. I'm really sorry Mrs. Ganush. Please, take your hands off me. But the old woman only clutches tighter.
t  I'm calling security. She picks up the phone and presses a button.
(into the phone) Could you please come over? Mrs. Ganush finally releases her grip and bows her head i humiliation.
You shame me. She composes herself. Then, slowly stands, puffing up her chest. Mu3tering her damaged pride.
I begged you... Her one. good eye fixes it's hardened gaze upon Stephanie

She arrives at her car and quickly gets inside, locking t doors behind her. She places the box of contracts on the next to her. Stephanie has time for only a single gulp of air be Mrs. Ganush grabs two fistfuls of Stephanie's hair!. The woman yanks upon it. Stephanie's head is pulled back, ove the edge of the seat. Ganush braces her feet against the of the front seat to pull even harder... Stephanie's neck now bent so far back it's about to snap! Stephanie's hand finds the stapler, trips the release. It springs open. She swings it back over her shoulder! Ka-Thunk! Ka-Thunk! Ka-Thunk! With each blow, she delivers a staple into Mrs. Ganush's forehead. Ka-Thunk! A lucky shot-- the old lady's white eye is stap shut. The old woman HOWLS, but her grip on Stephanie's hair onl tightens. Stephanie, about to black out, throws the car into gear a hits the gas. Then Stephanie is suddenly screaming herself, as the old 1 Woman has grabbed her legs and is dragging her from the Stephanie hits the pavement. She shields her face with he hands, waiting, but the blow never comes. The old woman standing above her, WHEEZING.

You shamed me. The Old Woman reaches down. Stephanie flinches. Mrs.'Ganu gnarled hand plucks a thin brass button from the sleeve o Stephanie's coat. She waves the button through the air, a breathes out a single word:
Lamia... Clouds move past the setting Sun. A shadow falls over Stephanie. A cold wind makes her shiver.
What--? What are you doing? Stephanie sits up, reaching for her button. But the old w 1 moves it out of reach.
You want it? Stephanie snatches the button back. Mrs. Ganush smiles cryptically as Stephanie stuffs the button into her coat pocket.
Soon it will be you, who comes begging to me. It begins tonight when you hear the cry.
What cry?

The Lamia. It's coming for you. A large black, BUZZING fly lands on Stephanie's face. She swats it away. Her vision blurs and she grows dizzy. She leans against the car for support. When she finally looks Mrs. Ganush is gone.
Stephanie and Ray have just finished filing a report with OFFICER NAIMARK.
What about a restraining order?

Well that's usually only something we do if there's a pattern of harassment. But like I said, we'll file a report and keep it on record in case you do have a continuing problem. But once we send an officer around to have a word with, her, I don't think she'll be bothering you again.
Thank you, you've been very helpful.
Stephanie and Ray eat ice cream cones as they walk past t shops.
I just thank God you're okay. You are okay, right?
I'm fine. Ray waits, sensing that there's more to it.
Your fine, but...
I-- It's just that I could have gotten her another extension. But I didn't.
Loo]. You said the bank had already granted her two extensions. (MORE)
RAY (cont'd) When you don't pay your mortgage you lose your house, what did she t expect?

I guess. A breeze. She shivers. He wraps his arms around her protectively and after a moment, they walk on. Stephanie watches wistfully as a YOUNG COUPLE coo over their BABY. Behind the couple, Stephanie notices a neon sign in a storefront window. It reads: PSYCHIC.
Let's get our fortune's read!
You're kidding right? She cajoles a protesting Ray through the front door of th establishment.
A tiny waiting room. A poster on the wall indicating the energy meridians of the human body.

I just hope to God none of my students see me here. Five bucks says he's wearing a turban. A beaded curtain parts, revealing... Rham Jas, a small, dark skinned, fifty year old Indian ma He wears a plain black suit and a white turban. His inquisitive eyes evaluate the couple.
I am Rham Jas. Seer.
How do you do? I'm Stephanie Brown and this is Ray...
But you probably already knew that. Just kidding. Rham Jas gives Ray a tight smile.
How can I help you?
We'd like to have our fortunes read. Can you do that? Read the future?
I have the ability to see certain energies... Sometimes these ' energies are a foretoken of things to come. Sometimes not. Sixty dollars, please.
Sixty dollars? Isn't that a little steep for this kind of thing?

Then go. There are many who would claim to be seers. But they are not. Although you would pay them little... you would receive nothing. If you.are not serious, go. Rham Jas turns to depart through the beaded curtain.
Wait. She removes some bills from her purse but Ray waves her o handing Rham Jas a credit card.

Platinum card. Very good. He swipes Ray's card through the credit card machine. INT Rham Jas'S BACK ROOM - NIGHT A sparsely furnished, dimly lit room. The walls are lined with old books. Rham Jas stands before Stephanie and Ray, sit at a card table. Stephanie giggles with excitement.
Sorry. Rham Jas smiles back.
That's quite all right. So, you wish to know something of your destiny. Very good. We shall see what the fates have in store. Rham Jas crosses to the window and closes the curtains.
Freud said destiny was not an act of fate but rather something created by our subconscious to control our conscious choices.
That is true. But... "We should not pretend to understand the world only by intellect."
Carl Jung...
Yes. From his treatise "Psychological types".
Ray studies this strange man as he strikes a match and li a candle. There's more to him than meets the eye. Ray bru it off.
Jung-- the New Agers' favorite psychologist.
Because he wasn't afraid to bring God into the equation. Rham Jas takes a seat at the table, across from Stephanie
Your hand, please. Stephanie extends her hand to Rham Jas. He closes his eye and concentrates. Stephanie smiles excitedly to Ray, who raises a skeptical eyebrow.
You,work with money.
That's right! 4
But... you've lost something.
No. I don't think so.
No. No, you're right. Something's been taken from you.
No, I- Rham Jas grabs her arm and turns it, revealing the thread that once held the button on her coat sleeve.
A button.
Well, yes! Some Old Woman...
Well anyone can see she lost a button. So what?
But Ray, it was very strange. At the bank today. The old woman... the one I told you about... she plucked the button right from my sleeve.
Why would she do that?

If you would please, both be quiet. Rham Jae concentrates, his eyelids flutter. Stephanie app uneasy. The flame of the candle begins to flicker as a br sweeps through the room. The wind chimes TINKLE. Ray pull his collar closed against the sudden chill in the air. Rh Jas's back stiffens. 4
He releases Stephanie's hand and stands. He moves away fr the table, uncomfortable. With a handkerchief,' he dabs perspiration from his brow.
I think that is enough for now.
Wait. You saw something. What?
I'm sorry. I'm tired and I see it's become quite late. Of course I will refund your money.
Tell me. Please. Rham Jas hesitates, then...
A bad spirit has come upon you.
How?
Did you blaspheme the dead while visiting a grave site?
No.
Do you play with Ouija board or confer with those who practice the black arts?
What is this?!
No. No, I didn't.
Then perhaps someone has cursed you.
Who? 0
Rham Jas turns her wrist, exposing the loose threads on h coat sleeve.
where the brass button once was.
Ray and Stephanie cruise along the dark, winding hills. R looks over at Stephanie.
How did he know all that?
Know what? That you lost,a button?1 He makes some good guesses, stirs you up, leaving you with a lot of questions. And conveniently, his business card. C'mon, he's a scam artist.
He didn't want the money. He tried to give the money back.

I guess so.
Ray and Stephanie step from the car. They open a rusting gate, and walk up the hilly path to Stephanie's slightly funky Silver Lake rental house.
Ray and Stephanie step inside. The kitten PURRS around Stephanie's feet. Ray picks it up.
So this is him. Got a name?
Uh... just "Kitty" so far.
She takes the cat from Ray, cuddles it.
Sure you don't want me to spend the night?
Don't tempt me. I've got to prep a presentation for the morning.
okay. Ray kisses her, opens the front door and exits. He calls to her from his car:
Remember, dinner at my folk's house, tomorrow night. We're supposed to bring desert. I could pick something up?
No. I'm planning on baking my special cake.
Sounds good. Try not to stay up too late. Ray waves and steps into his car. Stephanie watches him d off.

Stephanie site at the kitchen table in her flannel pajama entering financial data into her laptop. An episode of "Desperate Housewives" plays in the background on TV. A baking timer CHIMES. Stephanie removes a beautifully brow cake from the oven and sets it on the counter to cool. He roommate, ELLEN, comes down the stairs, snuggling the kit
Isn't he adorable?
Let's hope the landlord thinks so. She sets down,the kitten and picks up her overnight bag.
What about you? You going to be okay? You know, I don't have to go out tonight.
No, I'm fine. Have a good time.
Do I look great? Be honest. STEPHANIE. You look great. Ellen smiles, grabs her car keys and heads for the door.
But... Isn't that Marci's dress?

Yeah. And if she calls, tell her not to go bi-polar on me, I'll'get it back to her by tomorrow. Or the next day. Bye! Ellen exits. Stephanie places butter into a mixer for the cake frostin Through the kitchen window we can see Ellen walking down path, toward the street. She steps through the iron gate, latching it closed behind her.
Ellen's car pulls away. The wind kicks up, whisking leave about, as though something where moving up the path and toward the front gate of the house.

An unsettling SHRIEK! what the hell was that? Stephanie s down the measuring cup. She moves to the front door. Locks it. She looks out the kitchen window. The iron. gate is now o It SHRIEKS as it swings back and forth in the wind.

Suddenly, the latch gives way and the windows swing open! 1 Wind sweeps through the kitchen, whipping dead leaves a The hanging pans bang together! KLANG! KLANG! Stephanie forces the windows closed. The wind dies. The room grows eerily quiet. A car passes in the street below. It's headlights sweep across the house. The headlight beams throw moving shadow the wall. Stephanie notices that one particular shadow is darker than the others. It becomes the silhouette of Mrs. Ganush, but there's no one in the room with her. The car passes and the shadows vanish. Sensing something, the Kitten arches it's back. Now Steph feels it. A presence. The light bulb begins to sputter. She holds her breath, listens. The floorboards CREAK. Something is walking towards her. spins around, but there's nothing there. The SOUND of footsteps drawing closer. She backs against the wall, trembling. Suddenly Stephanie's face is struck by an invisible hand! cries out. Her mouth is bleeding. She runs for the door. She's almost there. Her hand reach for the knob, when something unseen picks her up.
